result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chester K Isom

records.addlTxt: BOND REVOKED, DEFENDANT TO BE HELD WITHOUT BOND PENDING SENTENCING.

10:59 AM Defendant Chester K Isom in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Ramirez for Addison R Kuhn in court for Chester K Isom.  Attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Oversight at plea hearing where defendant plead to OWI 5th, bond was not revoked at that time.
BTC: Bond revoked, defendant to be held without bond until sentencing.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
from DOC to the Court, more time to prepare PSI.
from DOC to the Court.

10:31 AM Defendant Chester K Isom in court, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Chester K Isom.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reporter Nancy Szeklinski. 

Plea - Parties are prepared to proceed with plea today. 
State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 
Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Guilty 
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY; PSI Ordered set matter for sentencing. 
Firearm and Voting warning.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

***ALSO $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all.
NG plea entered.

8:54 AM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chester K Isom in court, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Chester K Isom. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense moves to address bond, requesting a lower bond to become an inmate worker. 
State believes bond set to be appropriate. 
BTC: Bond motion granted bond modified to $900 cash and $5000 signature bond, same conditions apply.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
